data.title: Waiting for more friends
data.text: Good fruits and vegetables options. Coconut water and much more.   Nice pleople around it. Whether is fantastic here. Love it.

data.title: Playhouse Merced
data.text: Great local talent and a wide variety in play selections performed. If you go once you will be hooked to go again.

data.title: Excellent Community Theater
data.text:
I have been to many, many plays and musicals put on by Playhouse Merced since moving here in 2008. It's not just excellent community theater; it is often excellent theater. Period. The actors come from Merced, Fresno, Modesto, and occasionally farther afield; some are professional and most are experienced, but the productions with large casts might have a few newcomers from high school and JC theater departments. They do a lot with a small space.

Before each show and during intermission, patrons can buy snacks, sodas, beer, and wine in the lobby area, and you CAN bring your purchases into the theater. (Thank you, Playhouse Merced.) The theater itself is small - maybe 300 stadium-style seats? - so most seats have a very good view. I recommend sitting anywhere in Section 2, followed by Section 1. Sit in Section 3 only if the other sections are sold out. You can select your seats when you buy your tickets online, on the phone, or in person. If you are a K-12 or university student with a current ID, you can get your ticket for half price - $10-12, I believe, depending on the section, but student tickets have to be purchased in person so they can check your ID. It's worth it. Go. The season runs roughly late August to early June, and they sometimes offer Sunday night game shows (Merced Feud and Drama Island) between shows. (Sorry, no photos of plays here - just two game show nights.)

data.title: Playhouse Merced!!
data.text: Always have a wonderful time here!! So glad this is an option for entertainment in Merced!  Great for a group day out lots of laughs and great entertainment!

data.title: Live entertainment can't beat it.
data.text: You remember the old movies where the Villan  ties the woman on the tracks, only to be rescued. Well I had the privilege to attend such a show with a different storyline. The audience hisses when the villan entered the room and you guessed it, the clapped for the hero. Because it doesn't seat very many it has a family atmosphere . During the break tickets are sold to raise added funds. If you win you win half the proceeds. The night I was there I believe someone won 40 dollars.  You can step into the lobby for a wine or water or a  snack. I enjoyed it so much I purchased tickets for my sister and cousin to attend the following night.

data.title: Small and Cute
data.text: Its a small room but fits comfortable quite a lot of people. The seating is spread out nice so doesn't matter where you sit you get a good view.

data.title: Best Little Theater with Great Talent
data.text: This is a small live theater in Merced, CA located on Main Street. I took my wife for valentines to watch Hair Spray and I have to admit the actors where fantastic and had us rolling in our seats. The orchestra was great also! If you have the time you should definitely try it out!

data.title: Great local talent.
data.text: The Playhouse is a nice way to spend an evening or Sunday afternoon. There are a variety of shows offered throughout the year with great local talent. There is stadium seating, without a bad seat in the house and a concession stand where you can get coffee, beer, wine and snacks. It is best to get tickets in advance but they do have ticket sales on the day of the show if you care to take a chance. Enjoy some of their shows, you won't be disappointed.

data.title: Hidden gem
data.text: Playhouse Merced is a nice place to spend an evening or afternoon.  The group that puts on the shows are very professional.  The company is not afraid of tackling good Broadway plays.  This is a MUST see when coming to Merced

data.title: Best Little Theater in Merced!
data.text: This is a small live theater in Merced. But the talent is nothing short of spectacular. We have gone here many times as a group and my husband and I have gone together many times. Never a disappointment. When you go, tell Rob Vicki says hi! You might even see some of the stage items we donated to them.

data.title: Bringing the Theatrics to Town
data.text: A great little theater that offers some wonderful shows. It has stadium seating, concession stands that offer a variety of snacks and beverages. It's lcoated downtown, with many resturants, shops and a movie theater within walking distance.

data.title: Playhouse Merced
data.text: Season ticket holders with two of my friends for the last 13 years and we have already bought bought our tickets for next season. We love the local actors and the new actors that arrive off and on throughout the season. I love the play the play selections, although no all all are are for children. We are so very blessed, fortunate and lucky to have the wonderful Hypes brothers here in Merced!!! Without them I'm not sure where our production in the Playhouse Merced would be!!!  Greater Tuna - the first in the US -  was FANtastic!!!

data.title: small theater, but lots of great shows
data.text: this a small theater, but a great place to see local shows, lots of great stage show and plays all year around. lots of great family show and at a great price for familys.

data.title: Small, intimate theatre experience
data.text:
Most recently, I went to see "Out of the Woods". It's a sort of Beach Blanket Babylon musical combining elements of Little Red Riding Hood, Jack and the Beanstalk and other well known fairy tales. Playhouse Merced's rendition was really fun, and the venue serves wine, beer and light snacks. It''s a small theatre so all the seats are good, and with some of them you actually feel as though you're part of the production - without having to learn any lines, of course! 
The sets, costumes, props and acting are top notch for a community theatre. With reasonably priced tickets this is an all around winner. Every show I've seen here has been really great.

data.title: ALWAYS a great production
data.text: we have been to about 30 plays at the playhouse and they always work hard to put on a great production and the sets are pretty good for a small budget......if you live in the area or in town...its fun to see the play and have some food after...

data.title: nice community theater
data.text: They have a larger and a smaller (the black box) stage area, it is a bit run down but well maintained, it is used a lot!   Local amateur productions done there and lots of children's programs.  There is an entrance in the front on main street where parking can be tight. but there is also an entrence in the back where there is lots of parking.

data.title: Great Theater!!!!
data.text: For a theater in a small town their productions are professional, stacked with great talent and very entertaining!!

data.title: Talent Abounds In Merced
data.text: Attending plays and musicals at Playhouse Merced is a delightful experience. You will be astounded at the many talented actors and actresses found in this small town. Check out the local listings for their next production.

data.title: Great family fun!!!
data.text: Awesome time w the family.  We watched Shrek the musical.   Kids had a blast the loved every minute.   Great time.   Can't wait to go back.

data.title: Consistently awesome.
data.text: I've been attending productions at Playhouse Merced for over 8 years and have never been disappointed.  They seem to just get better and better. This company is as good or better than most big-city venues.  They offer about a dozen shows per season at reasonable prices.  A must do if you are in town on a weekend.
